descendants.content:
@SJHoodlet @CA_Hawthorne

Probably was a tornado TBH, they can occur pretty much anywhere.

The UK gets loads, they just don't last long and seldom do damage - though I've been present at the two most damaging in the last 20 years - but I promise I wasn't near you last night.

Hope it gets sorted out quickly.

descendants.content: @CA_Hawthorne I was about to ask if the lighting in the first photo was due to smoke, it has that hazy sky quality to it. When we had the tornado blow through town a couple months ago (a weather event that never happens here), crews from the surrounding states came within 48-hours to get the power grid back up. It took the better part of a week to get it all back. Really hoping that they can get some additional crews out to help everyone :ablobcatheartsqueeze:

descendants.content: @anderlandbooks I’m in western Montana in the US. I see signs of global warming more each year, even here. The summers become hotter each year, the droughts longer, the smoke worse, and our local glaciers are all but gone. To think that I consider us fortunate here compared to most locations.

descendants.content: @KurtHohmann Tornadoes are terrifying. I can’t imagine having them on a regular basis. The new normal is that there is no normal. Just about anything goes. Almost exactly one year ago I climbed a small peak and had to hurry down to escape the remnants of the hurricane that struck California.

account.note:
Science fiction and fantasy writer with a green tinge.

Woke and proud.

I'm not right, left or centre. I'm a logicalist. An ally of all races, gender identities and sexualities.

Published novels: Zero Magenta, Stone & Sceptre, and Vega Rising. The last two being from fantasy series, The Nifaran Chronicles.

My current WIP is a sci-fi called Proxi.

I love sci-fi and fantasy TV, movies and games.

Also interested in electric cars.

account.note:
Poet & SF&F author. Potter. Crafter. Community Organizer. Relentless optimist. Local foodie & sourdough wrangler. Curious maker. Owned by 2 former shelter dogs. Neuro-Atypical. Grey Ace. Earnest to a fault. Recovering city mouse in Central MA. She/Her

account.note:
I like writing #SciFi and #fantasy stories. I write for pleasure and probably never will get published.
I have simple tastes and write simple stories.
I like my garden, all animals (especially my dog), all plants, science, the ocean and Canada. I'm German but write mostly in English for practice.
TERFs, fascists, antisemites get blocked. Overgeneralizing boomer-bashers too.
© GH Learner for my content here.

fields.value: she/her

descendants.content: @gahlearner Thank you. It was honestly the most that weather has ever scared me. Out of nowhere, we had 109mph winds, continual lightning, and almost no rain. In less than an hour it brought the city to its knees. I was without power for 37 hours. I think Mother Nature is conducting a master class in climate change and she’s just getting warmed up.
